p.value:
Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F.
        Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment,
        tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

Tom Sarbaugh, a bibliographer and historian of the air war in Spain, compiled extensive
        files of material on aviation during the Spanish Civil War. He contributed copies of much of
        his research material to the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives when they were housed at
        Brandeis University (before 2001). The collection includes correspondence, most of it with
        Victor Berch, Archivist of the ALBA collections at Brandeis, published and unpublished
        articles, bibliographies and bibliography cards, copies of documents, lists, and
        translations (most by Sarbaugh, some by others). Items by Sarbaugh include: "Spanish Civil
        War Aviators in Literature and Popular Fiction" and "Hidden History: Catalan Women Pilots
        for the Spanish Republic" (1987).
